title: Miley Cyrus defends herself against huge backlash for saying gay women 'gave up on d**k'
text:

Miley Cyrus has been forced to defend herself after sparking a huge backlash by accusing lesbian and bisexual women of "giving up on d**k".

The Wrecking Ball singer, 26, took to Twitter on Monday night to say that it's her "priority to protect the LGBTQ community" that she's part of and insisted her words had been blown out of proportion.

She tweeted: "I was talking s*** about sucky guys, but let me be clear, YOU don't CHOOSE your sexuality. You are born as you are.

"It has always been my prority to protect the LGBTQ community I am a part of. Happy Monday!"

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Twitter)

It all started when she was doing an Instagram live story with her new boyfriend Cody Simpson in which she told her female followers "you don't have to be gay".

Miley said: "Don't give up. You don't have to be gay, there are good people with d**ks out there, you just gotta find them.

"You just gotta find a d**k that's not a d**k, you know what I mean?"

(Image: Suzy Creamcheese / SplashNews.com)

While Cody laughed in the background, she added: "I always thought I had to be gay, because I just thought all guys are evil, but that's not true."

Miley received hundreds of angry comments, man branding them "insulting" and "invalidating".

But even after she clarified what she meant, many weren't so quick to forgive her.

(Image: Instagram)

One tweeted: "I understood your intentions but it still came off wrong and made some people feel s****y. Thank you for clarifying of course but please just try to be more aware of what you are saying and how you are saying it in the future."

Another posted: "So many of us smilers LOVE her and felt like her comments were biphobic. She has a HUGE base in the LGBTQA community and it's important for her to clarify her words."

A third said: "We know you were joking, but it still came out bad."
description: The Wrecking Ball singer, 26, took to Twitter to say that it's her 'priority to protect the LGBTQ community'
